column5: I'm heading north on Saturday for a 7 day musky trip and wanted to be sure my #1 reel, a Calcutta TE 400, was working as good as possible so I dropped it off at Shimano in Peterboro Friday afternoon.  They just called to say it's all ready.  It was completely stripped down & cleaned in some sort of bath, reassembled with new drag washers and lubricated and made like new again.  All for $30  Pretty impressive in my books.
Good deal there Lew , nothing but good things to say about Shimano
I gotta send in my reels, why I didn't in the off season is beyond me
I meant to take this one in earlier too and totally forgot about it till Friday. I was worried they couldn't do it in time but they really came through for me.

I meant to take this one in earlier too and totally forgot about it till Friday. I was worried they couldn't do it in time but they really came through for me.  Must have been your smile.  If I lived closer I'd take some of mine in. I've got a TE that's not as smooth as a B and a Curado that could use some professional tlc.
Must have been your smile.  It works every time Rob
You got ripped off....they only charged me $20 lol....must be the smile  S$
You got ripped off....they only charged me $20 lol....must be the smile  S$  Maybe there's a new Wynne tax added on
Good deal for sure! Enjoy your trip Lew, here's hoping the weather cooperates for you.
Thanks Mike, it's always a great trip & the forecast is looking pretty good....so far.
